list_definition.definition: the lowest floor of a building, usually below ground level

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There’s a wine cellar in the basement of the house

list_ex_of_english: In addition, passive bending of the structures, resulting from pinning on the uplifted basement block probably also accounts for the fold-belt curvature.
Upon reaching the surface, the vacuoles were fused, leading to disruption of the apical region of syncytial tegument along the basement layer.
The basement is thought to be oceanic crust, generated either at a mid-ocean ridge or by back-arc spreading dependent on the favoured model.
The fold is cut by juxtaposed thrusts giving rise to the formation of three structurally higher basement-dominated thrust sheets.
However, typical geometries are truncated by subsequent generation of basement inherited faults.
The inner crater in the crystalline basement is often the only part of the concentric structure that is preserved or recognizable.
Only a few theca cells were still attached to the basement membrane.
Structurally, the skin consists of epidermis, dermis and basement membrane zone.
